You know that moment when you're finally ready to tackle your to-do list? "Just need to check one thing online real quick," you tell yourself. Next thing you know, it's 2 hours later and you've watched 14 different "how to be productive" videos on YouTube (ironic, right?), read every news article about that random topic you suddenly HAD to know about, and somehow ended up deep in threads about conspiracy theories involving pigeons. Meanwhile, that important task? Still sitting there, untouched.
Hedge is here to help break this cycle. It's not another complicated "productivity system" ‚Äì it's a straightforward Chrome extension that helps you stay focused by keeping you away from the sites that always seem to pull you away from what matters.

About Permissions ‚ÑπÔ∏è

When you install Hedge, you'll notice it requests permission to "Read and change all your data on the websites you visit." This might sound broad, but it's necessary for Hedge to do its job effectively - we need this permission to recognize and block distracting websites when you're trying to focus. Think of it like a bouncer who needs to check IDs at every door to keep the party running smoothly!
For total transparency: Hedge needs these permissions to function as your productivity guardian, helping you stay on track across all websites you visit. We take this responsibility seriously and use these permissions solely for the purpose of keeping you focused and productive.
